question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/executor.rs] [Function: worker_loop_v2()] [Module Validation Deferred] At lines 1520-1535, module validation can be deferred with finish_cold_validation_requirement() - can deferred validations be lost if the worker crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/executor.rs] [Function: gen_block_epilogue()] [Gas Price Manipulation] At lines 2068-2076, the calculation (gas_price - gas_price_to_burn) is used without overflow checks - can high gas prices cause integer overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/executor.rs] [Function: gen_block_epilogue()] [Storage Fee Bypass] At line 2070, storage_fee_used().div_ceil(gas_price) is subtracted - can this be manipulated to distribute storage fees that should be burned? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/executor.rs] [Function: gen_block_epilogue()] [Proposer Index Validation] At line 2056, proposer_index() is used without validation - can malformed auxiliary_info cause out-of-bounds access or incorrect fee distribution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/executor.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_sequential()] [Failpoint Exploitation] At lines 2354-2356 and 2371-2373, fail_point! macros can force serialization failures - are these properly guarded in production? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/executor.rs] [Function: apply_output_sequential()] [Aggregator Duplicate] At line 2140, assert_none! checks for duplicate aggregator creation - but in concurrent scenarios, can this assertion be violated? (Low)
